DataElement.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether the ECOG performance status was equal to or less than 2.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the ECOG performance status.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) was established in 1955. This is a cooperative group (Philadelphia, PA) funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.:A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A cooperative group funded primarily by the NCI, one of the largest clinical cancer research organizations in the US, incorporating universities, medical centers, Community Clinical Oncology Programs, and Cooperative Group Outreach Programs with almost 6000 physicians, nurses, pharmacists, statisticians, and clinical research associates from the US, Canada, and South Africa. ECOG has more than 90 active clinical trials in all types of adult malignancies. Annual accrual is 6,000 patients, with more than 20,000 patients in follow-up.
A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Property.preferredDefinition: Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG performance status (PS)
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status (PS) 0, 1, or 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG (Zubrod) Performance Status <= 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG Performance Status 0-1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Subject has ECOG Performance Status of 0, 1 or 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status of 0 or 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG (Zubrod) performance status of 1 or less

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status of >=60 (Appendix II) or ECOG performance status 0, 1, or 2 (Appendix V). The same scoring system should be used throughout the study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS) 0, 1 or 2

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an ECOG performance status of 0 or 1?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Karnofsky performance status of >=60 or ECOG performance status 0, 1, or 2. The same scoring system should be used throughout the study

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text9
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status of 0-1 (Karnofsky >= 70%)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status of 0-1 (Karnofsky >=80%)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status <= 2 (Karnofsky >= 60%)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG Performance status of 0-1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a performance status of 0 or 1 on the ECOG Performance Scale

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Performance status of <=1 on the ECOG Performance Scale

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: ECOG performance status of 0-1 or a Karnofsky >= 80%

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have performance status corresponding to ECOG scores of 0, 1, or 2?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a score of 2, 1, or 0 on the ECOG performance status scale

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has an ECOG Performance Status of 0, 1, 2, or 3?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an ECOG performance status of 0, 1, or 2 or Karnofsky performance status above 60?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient  have an ECOG performance status of 2 or less (or Karnofsky greater than or equal to 60%)?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has an ECOG Performance Status of 0 or 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG_03
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participant has an ECOG Performance Status of 0, 1 or 2.
